Reviews.Title: “No.”
Reviews.Author: dr_freud
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be odd - I guess because it doesn't feel like a hotel. Other large hotels have some sense of character. This one has no personality at all. It's as though they built an office block, and turned it into a hotel. The entrance and lobby and restaurants are all on different floors. As others have mentioned the reception staff, while polite and reasonably efficient don't seem to understand the meaning of 'hospitality" i.e. smile, make people feel welcome etc. In this hotel, they feel as though they are processing you into a prison. Parked near the Taxi lobby are a whole lot of expensive old cars -e.g. vintage Jaguars and even an old Rolls or Bentley - but why are they there? Is it supposed to give a sense of grandeur, does the owner live in a penthouse above the hotel? It's all so incongruous.. As for the rooms - I don't like 1970's wood veneer cupboards and bedsides etc. It's just like an old motel which they've tried to turn into a 5 star hotel and produced a characterless place. Beds like stone - if you like a firm bed, you will find this hard, if you like a more luxurious feel - stay somewhere else!! Corridors on the room floors are very dark with little lights -why did they do this, it's just weird. Only the swimming pool looks nice, haven't tried it yet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room”
Reviews.Author: hugoinlove
Reviews.Content: Hong kong island is a very small island, you could pretty much scale it all by just walking around. Hotel provide free transportation to Central (airport express stop), as well as several shopping/recreation destinations. Staff were ok, not particularly friendly (the receptionist), but the bell boy and concierge is quite professional. Hotel room is quite nice, but begins to show age, hotel should do a better job in maintaining its facilities especially cleaning standards in hotel rooms (bathroom in particular). Restaurant is terrible, if you can, please try to avoid it!! I tried it all (breakfast, lunch, and dinner), all very dissappointing. Breakfast being the worst, totally not worth the money you paid!! stay away! You can walk to the nearby Ocean park (very boring and completely packed!!), or take a short taxi ride to enjoy outlet shopping at Horizon plaza, or sampling cantonese seafood on Jumbo! Would return again only if price is good.

Reviews.Title: “Rare, spacious rooms in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JCPY
Reviews.Content: L Hotel My husband and I stayed here on 31 July-3 Aug and we loved: 1. The promptness of the staff in replying my email-request to store our luggage on 23-31 July. 2. The spaciousness of the room 3. The bath in the room 4. The punctuality of the shuttle bus driver in picking us up at IFC 5. The clean and bright gym which overlooks the pool 6. The availability of 2 lifeguards at the pool We disliked: 1. Being allocated a room which was on the same floor as members of a tour group. They were inconsiderate of others and shouted to one another along the corridor at 7.30am and at 11pm+. 2. Being allocated in the room nearest to the elevator. Hence...(refer to point 1) 3. The toilet bowl which broke down on the second day we stayed there. The entire bathroom floor was flooded with water. Tips: 1. Take lift to P4 level. 2. Exit and turn left to take another lift to P1. 3. Walk towards the bus stop. 4. Take bus no 75 and it will take you to Pedder Street. This is nearer to Lan Kwai Fong and Queen's Road Central area than taking the hotel's shuttle bus to IFC. Costs less than HKD5. 5. Take bus no 72a, 75 or 107 if you'd like to go to causeway bay. Alight at the stop right after the toll booth. 6. Take bus no 107 if you'd like to go to Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near ocean park reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireWanderer
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a reasonably priced hotel for 3 nights before transferring to husband's hotel when he arrived on business later in the week. Very good price online. Upgraded to club facility on arrival which included free drinks,breakfast and snacks.Although the hotel is out of town we didn't find this a problem as we have been to Hong Kong many times before and know our way round. The free shuttle service to town was great and very convenient. We also used it to go to Ocean park after we had checked out. The hotel kept our bags and we returned in the evening to collect them and get the shuttle in to town for our next hotel. Children loved the pool and as it was very hot we made full use of it before and after sightseeing. Room was very comfortable and modern. Liked the bathroom and found the dressing gowns useful to go to the pool. A very good stay at a reasonable price In a larger than average room. Staff pleasant particularly at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: AMSINGH
Reviews.Content: Its good hotel near the city centre. We stayed there as part of our ciompany group in september. Even being part of a big group we had to wait for 2 hours for check in as the rooms were only alloted at the checkin time. Hotel design and rooms are excellent. Our room on higher floor had Hill view. The location of the hotel is very Far from the city centre. It is very near to Ocean Park and very convient for families spending time there. The taxi are ararnged by staff very conviently in the level below lobby by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in Aberdeen with poor staff”
Reviews.Author: thatsgreatforme
Reviews.Content: We have family in Aberdeen and thought that we should try this nearby hotel. It's modern, new and well appointment, it's unfortunate that the staff were almost all terrible. Check in at 2am was a slow and rude, check out was slow and stupid, no one offered to help with our luggage even though we were travelling with an infant. The suite layout was poorly designed and thought out. We had 2 rooms with 3 doors to access them, very silly. Lots of little niggling things, like the pool was closed for half of our visit with no warning or apology. Breakfast was well below average and the staff again were terrible. When my wife approached them they tried to walk the other way and ignore her! Ultimately its a new hotel with good rooms, but the staff and layout are a hassle. If you can overlook rude an inept people and inconvenient design then this might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky location, great value”
Reviews.Author: 2children5nations
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights, arranged at short notice when other travel plans changed. It was my first time in Hong Kong, and this was a great base from which to explore this awesome city, even though it is a little out of the way. In fact, we liked its location, and that we didn't stay in Central or Kowloon, as it gave us a little sense of 'coming home' at the end of each day, and also spurred us to explore interesting areas like Aberdeen, which you may not if you were staying more centrally. Moreover, it was incredible value for money compared to other places we considered. The style is contemporary and modern and it all feels well cared for. The outdoor pool on the 2nd floor terrace is really nice in general, and excellent for babies and children. Our room was a double and had such a big bed that we ditched the extra single in preference for extra floor space and all four of us slept comfortably in one bed! Wifi is free. Concierge would advise that all restaurants are a taxi ride away, and that would largely be true, but we did discover a couple of good options if you like local Chinese food and street food. First, a great dimsum place (open morning and afternoon but not seemingly in the evening), outside the street-level back entrance (turn left). Secondly, the hot food market, can't remember the name of it, but is about 5 mins away, near the building site of the new subway. Also there's a Starbucks the other side of the highway, behind the petrol station, which comes in handy if you're not having breakfast at the hotel. Agree with other reviewers that breakfast is pretty poor, so only tried that the once. One other criticism would be that concierge, whilst very friendly, did not seem particularly knowledgeable about the city. But on the whole, we were really impressed...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: transientduchess
Reviews.Content: this hotel is clean, modern and stylish. The service is great. Flatscreen, good storage space in the room (cupboard to hang clothes, desk etc) The only reason I give it "very good" instead of "excellent" is because whenever I stay there the pool is closed. It is only open during certain months and I usually come in March. To me it is definitely hot enough to swim but not to the management. I haven't eaten much in the hotel and my discount rate never includes breakfast, so can't really comment on the food. If you are staying in Hong Kong because of activities around the Island South area than this is a great value place to to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Content: I bought the package with including one superior room and 2 X ocean park tickets. The hotel location is quite hard to search and quite far from the central. But it is a perfect choice for you to visit ocean park. Ocean Park can be reached from hotel with walking around 10 mins. The room is clean. The bed is soft. But some of the front dest staff is not professional and even no smiling to guest. No restaurant, no convenience store near hotel. In my personal comment, This hotel is not recommended for staying if you are not visiting ocean park. .

Reviews.Title: “Wan Chai Love hotels are more accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: At first glance this place seems to have it all; good location, modern furnishings and decor....but so did Hitler's bunker. Apart from anything else; you can not eat, drink or move your chairs closer while you're by the pool...in fact sitting down and shutting up to admire the concreted hillside opposite is all that the poolside offers. (except for the latest 'Now that's what I call appalling' music playlist.) The food which requires no preparation (coffee, cheese) is ok because all they have to do is spend money on it but anything that requires the slightest bit of human contact is left severely wanting (croissants left under a desk lamp don't taste good no matter how expensive the butter is). Basically DO NOT be fooled by the L' as it belies no Parisien charm or Bordeaux beauty whatsoever. In fact the only thing slightly French about the place is the rudeness of the staff. All in all, find a good park bench with a starbux next door, and you (and the entire family) will have a better holiday experience than at this badly run, inhuman, boring, unfriendly "hotel". Its as if there is native unrest just outside the gates and this joke of a hotel only houses the staff that don't have the sense to run for the hills. Stay away...for God's sake, stay away!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: IamHereIamThere
Reviews.Content: *Excellent price point especially in Hongkong where other hotels are very expensive. *The location might be a put off for Business people as it is located around 1.5 hours from Airport, though in a quiet location. *Construction around the hotel still going on which can be a put off.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: samd007
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for Ocean Park fans as it is nearby, plus free shuttle to main town as well. One can lose time in commuting if South Island is not the primary destination. Value for money decent hotel compared to more expensive town hotels.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hotel Aberdeen District”
Reviews.Author: wnash
Reviews.Content: Ambience is really good. Though you have to remember where the entrance is into the hotel, it is from the smaller street, though there is a "small" entrance on the main road. The hotel is close to Ocean Park and I think in 2014/15 the MRT will be close by too. Breakfast was part of my deal and it was OK, though the bacon was a big disappointment. Internet is also supplied, but it is not very quick and they have a gym too for some morning exercise. At the time of visiting HK every hotel on the island was advertising 2000 HKD per night, and L'Hotel was 850 HKD per night and closer to work too.

Reviews.Title: “Wish i had more time”
Reviews.Author: 1037thebeat
Reviews.Content: Everything i expected. Nice quiet location. Big size rooms with modern look. Reasonable price and staff who understand english. Looking forward to coming back there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! if you are staying island side”
Reviews.Author: Jaydeep S
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in aberedeen or that side this is a great option. Very good rooms! don't forget to bargain.....! Good service and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very VFM modern comfortable hotel but average service”
Reviews.Author: maddash-traveler
Reviews.Content: My first impression of their service was when I landed up at 1pm on 16 April to check in. But they politely and nicely reminded me that checkin time was 2pm only. Because the room was "being done up". Now honestly - in a hotel with ~600 rooms (almost 400+ of my type), I refuse to believe that there was no room available to give to me (and I had a corporate booking). There was only one couple waiting there before me (and only one other couple turned up till 2pm). Pretty perplexing actually. Compare this with my cheap but lovely hostel stay, where they let me check in before 11am - because the room was available! It has nice views of the aberdeen running track and the boat club. That aside, its a well done hotel (see the pics) and has great facilities and a shuttle service to central (else just take bus # 70). At this price/comfort, it doesn't make sense to stay downtown and pay 2x the price. The morning breakfast wasn't much to write home about. Pretty limited spread for the buffet actually. Quite a non-starter (I'm a non-picky Indian eggetarian who likes more than the usual breads/cornflakes)

Reviews.Title: “stayed april 30 to may 4 2012 very nice hotel n location”
Reviews.Author: bostonmale
Reviews.Content: we picked this hotel because it close to ocean park and away from the city but easy to get to any place by bus. we could walk to Aberdeen central where there are shops and restaurants. the hotel shuttle bus brings you to ocean park and causeway bay which r American high end stores. Ocean park has many rides, dolphin and seal shows and the cable car that takes you to another part of the park which gives u an great view of the ocean and mountains. we didnt go to the Peak because the cable car in ocean park gives you just as nice views. Back to the hotel, im thinking 5 star, we chose the king size bedroom looking at an big mountain from the huge windows, they do have balcony rooms on the higher floors, we were on the 26th floor that didnt have an balcony. the other side of building your view would be factory buildings. there is only one restaurant, we went for the buffet at night which had everything from beef to seafood. was worth the price 800 hong Kong dollars for 2. the room was big enough along with the bath n shower. very clean and friendly staff that spoke english which is hard to find. we walked to Aberdeen to eat. it seems that the Chinese dont like to talk to us foreigners. i found that in bejing too. the taxi fare was 400 hk dollars from the airport but u can take public transport from the airport to hotel cheaper. we stayed for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but location :(”
Reviews.Author: SuyoungKim
Reviews.Content: L Hotel was surprisingly good for the price. The room was clean, well-equipped and flawless. The common area and restaurant is decorated in contemporary style as if it's a fake W hotel. However the location is tricky as it's about 20 minute drive from Central. There're shuttle buses every 30 minutes but you have to be organized to get it right on time. I missed it several times that I ended up paying for taxis. Breakfast is HK$118 extra and gym is quite small. Swimming pool is nice but facing cliff. In conclusion, if you're organized and willing to take shuttle buses, you can stay at this great hotel for so much less price!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: yyzcupcakes
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for three nights, and it was surprisingly good stay. It was booked on airline miles, and I wasn't hoping for much when I booked it. I knew of the proximity to Ocean Park, but I actually didn't see that many children. The rooms were bright, clean, and modern. It wasn't a big deal to get to the places we needed to go, either -- a taxi from the hotel to Central was about 60 HKD (less than $10 USD). There is also a shuttle bus that will take you to Hong Kong Station and a few other places, but we never used it. Hotels in Hong Kong can be expensive, so if you can get a good deal for this one, the out-of-the-way location is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “CAVEAT EMPTOR - BUYER BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: w999
Reviews.Content: The 'western' style breakfast (HK$110) leaves a lot to be desired, apparently they do not know how to cook scrambled or boiled eggs. Tried peeling the "hard boiled" eggs and each day they would just collapse into a gooey uncooked mess...the scrambled eggs came swimming in batter. WATCH OUT! Local calls are HK$5/pc, nice little surprise upon checkout. Also, checkout can take awhile..took me half an hour of waiting around in a big crowd. Also, don't rely on their free shuttles as they fill up fast and way ahead of time leaving you to wait around in a long line for taxis. On the positive side, the price is reasonable for HK (albeit way out of the way and next to absolutely nothing) and the wifi internet is free and fast. Oddly, when checking out you are given the option of selecting a HKD amount or a Canadian Dollar amount (USD for US cards probably). Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Night”
Reviews.Author: rbrown406
Reviews.Content: Recently spent one night at this hotel. The hotel itself is very nice. The room was a very nice size, the decor very nice, and all the necessary items were provided. The location is the biggest drawback for this hotel but since they are working on bringing the MTR nearby this will not be a problem in the somewhat distant future. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful. The food was quite nice although, as always in Hong Kong, a bit pricey! For someone visiting for a short stay, and especially if you intend to visit Ocean Park, it is a great place. If you intend to stay many days and visit the main areas of town frequently it is not your best choice unless you do not mind the transportation issues with being in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for family who want to enjoy Ocean Park”
Reviews.Author: TravelerThere
Reviews.Content: It is located on Hong Kong Island, very near to Ocean Park less than 5 min drive. We took the express train from airport to the Hong Kong Station, went down to the basement and waited for the hotel's free shuttle bus. Hotel staffs were friendly and helpful. They are trained in Geology. Food prices in restaurant are very expensive. Suggest to go to Aberdeem to eat or take the free shuttle to the other part of Hong Kong Island. The room size is very spacious consider Hong Kong's limited land. We had 2 adults and 3 young kids (age 5, 3 and 9 mth). Baby cot is only 3 x 2 ft , very small. We had the room facing the hill. The big window and extra sitting area are very good. The hotel offers 2 day Ocean Park pass for the price of 1 day. It is a plus feature for family who might take longer time to enjoy the park. They also provided free shuttle to Ocean Park. Trip to take the shuttle was to be there early as the shuttle can be filled up quite fast. The famous but expensive Jumbo Floating Restaurant is also within walking distance. But it is tricky to get there as you have to use a back street. There isn't much around the hotel. Only Nam Long Shan food court which is about 10 min walk up hill. It has more food stalls. There is a web-site where someone wrote their recommendation on it. We past by a cafeteria a few min toward Aberdeem. But didn't go in and look, so not sure what is selling inside. No shopping mall within walking distance. However, Aberdeem is only less than 5 min drive. To get there from the hotel, cross over to the opposite side of the hotel on the main road, then, take a taxi. It costs HKG20. If you take a taxi from the hotel, it will have to make a long u-turn up the road, which can be quite costly. Taxi can only turn left on the main road after exiting the hotel but Aberdeem is on the right side. It is a good, spacious hotel when you want to spend more time in Ocean Park. We stayed there for 4 nights and took taxis or their free shuttle to other part of the island. It was an overall very pleasant hotel stay consider the cleanliness and space we had.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Practical Choice IF”
Reviews.Author: Sheila L
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is good, it is clean and well maintained, aside from some minor damages that were not repaired (i.e. Blinds in the room), but if you are not very "PETTY" like I am, you can hardly notice it....Services?! considering their "natural" level of customer service in the whole country, I guess they are already trying their best but you have to re-calibrate your standard a LOT.....Love the balcony, first time I heard of an upgrade to 1st floor, but when I saw it I immediately got it, really a nice treat for me, the balcony is not just big, it was well maintained and kept clean even the chairs and table and you can literally sit back, relax, feel the breeze and enjoy the view of the hillside. All in all if you are on a tight budget on hotels, this is really good hotel for the price but you have to know your way through the country and make sure to use the MTR from the Airport Express Station and look for the L' Hotel Island South Free Shuttle Service that runs on a very PUNCTUAL schedule, ergo to the DOT. And don't use the TAXI, unless you are not in a rush to get to the hotel to check in and rest. Also, the hotel is so strategically located to Ocean Park and with same Free Shuttle Service you can get there for "fare-" and "hassle-free" as long as you tailor your sched to theirs. All in all, if you are a practical, independent tourist or visitor to Hong Kong and need no pampering from people at all -aside from Hotel facilities-, then L' Hotel Island South should be part of your short list at least.

Reviews.Title: “Price is a bargain but location - not for the first time visit in HK”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 children) stayed at L'Hotel Island South for 10 days in February 2012. Our family has visited Hong Kong multiple times, so we knew what we were getting into when we booked a room from Southside of the island. If you are visiting Hong Kong the first time, I would recommend to book a room from the other side (Central-Causeway Bay) island, since the traffic connections from the hotel are rather poor. However, there is an excellent free shuttle service from the hotel, but you are tied to the schedules and route of the shuttle. Taking the taxi from the hotel is not a probelm and it usually costs you 60-80 HKD to get to Times Square or Central, no biggie. In the vicinity of the hotel there are very few restaurants (mainly lunch restaurants for locals), one Starburcks in the next block (closes around 20:00 hrs) and one 7-11 that is not open around the clock. You are pretty much stranded in the hotel. If you are more interested in Stanley (nice beach, nice small market area), Repulse bay or the fish market of Aberdeen, then this hotel offers an excellent location. When the MTR station opens up in 2016, this will all be very different. Ocean Park is literally around the corner, so if you want to spend a few days in Ocean Park, this is definitely a hotel to consider. A word of warning though, if you enter through Main gates, you cannot exit any longer from Aberdeen side, so entry and exit gates are now both located in the same area. Once you have walked through the entire Ocean park area and you have two tired kids (or senior citizens) with you, be prepared to walk back to the train or cabel car to get away from the park. Traffic past the hotel is very heavy, so ask for a room from hill side or from higher floors (15 and above). The scenery is nothing to talk about, no thrills. Service and restaurants vere adequate, but still limited. The staff were very friendly and everything in our room worked, housekeeping sometimes needed some extra encouragement to clean and make our room, but nothing major. The hotel has one breakfast/lunch/dinner area and one small bar. The lounge is strangely right across the reception desk and several guests took it )a very open access) for a restaurant only to discover that you are soon hushed away from the lounge if you have not proper access. Rooms were clean, but small as typically in Hong Kong. All the basic services were available. The interior design of the hotel was dark but beautiful with many small details. So, the price is good, shuttle will get you to the Central for free, Ocean park is around the corner as well as Aberdeen, but for a first time visit in Hong Kong, I recommend to stay closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms, good base to explore the Islands but otherwise not a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mitmit0401
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very big by hong kong hotel standard. the lobby design is quite cool, and they do have free shuttle bus service that takes you to airport express station which is quite nice. it's 30 mins away at least so with traffic jam you need to make sure you have budget in the time so not to miss your flight. the location is frankly a weird and it's located in between two factory buildings. i guess this hotel is a factory building conversion. if you don't mind about that this is not a bad place to stay. the room quality is more or less no frills, but i was not expecting anything fancy when i booked this hotel so completely fine by me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: bal789
Reviews.Content: I would love to give L'Hotel a great review based on the hotel itself and the quality of the staff. However, I was completely let down by the amount of noise in the hotel during my two week break. Focusing on the positives, the hotel itself is great and the location was not a problem. Having stayed in a variety of Hong Kong hotels closer to central, I was concerned about where L'Hotel was located. However much to my surprise the shuttle bus is extremely convenient and punctual. It only took 10-15 minutes to get to central, which is nothing compared to how long it can take to even get across central! The perks of being in its location were that the hotel was situated in a quiet yet industrial area without the hustle and bustle of the city centre. The staff were informative and polite at all times from the moment I checked in until check out reflecting on the standard of their professionalism. At around 8am every morning the hotel became exceptionally noisy. The cleaning staff insisted on leaving the doors of the rooms they were cleaning open, which caused noise throughout the corridor. Cleaning staff also had a habit of screaming at one another across the hallways which interfered with my sleep. If you're ever looking for a slight lie-in, you won't find it at L'Hotel. I moved rooms 6 TIMES during my two week stay because of a variety of malfunctions including being given a twin room instead of a double and building noise. However, staff were always to accomodate my request and for one night I was even upgraded to a suite. In addition, throughout my stay I was given rooms with a mountain view despite paying for a city view. I do believe there are other hotels in Hong Kong with a much better sleep quality, and more professional cleaning staff. But L'Hotel is perfect for the deep sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “it was fun and enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: honeypie19
Reviews.Content: very affordable and good for the family must come back again...it was accessible but it was quite far from the city but still you can manage and enjoy the vacation with the family

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable as a four star hotel. Location is not bad as expected, but room quality can be better.”
Reviews.Author: lickman99
Reviews.Content: I think the location is acceptable, although it is located in industrial area and rounded by some factories. It is close to the city around 10 mins in public transport and the hotel is provided shuttle bus frequently. The decoration is fairly good as a four stars hotel. The hotel upgraded as king size bed. Inside the room, overall design is simple, clean and new, but carpet is more preferred. There is also some problem in controlling air-conditioner, no warm air even torn as heat. We just torn it off it last.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lcfb
Reviews.Content: My first time stay was a good surprise. I had to go to Hong Kong for a short trip and booked this hotel on Expedia. I was extremely surprised. I arrived late in the evening but managed to have a great dinner at the restaurant. Check in and check out went smoothly and the staff at the door were extremely helpful to get a taxi for the day. They helped me negotiate with a taxi driver. I always found it difficult to find a taxi during peak hours in HK and therefore decided to book ataxia for the whole day including the trip to the airport. The rooms are clean and of good size.

Reviews.Title: “A great 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: robirob15
Reviews.Content: Even though the location might scare aou off at first, I can definetly recommend this place. You can be in the city center in 10-15 min, there is even a shuttle bus provided by the hotel. The gym and the pool are a basic, but nice. Something the hotel is missing, is a relly good restaurant and bar. There are plenty of better options in Hong Kong. Besides that, the rooms are very nice and clean and the staff was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but big room”
Reviews.Author: EllenB545
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-December at a cut-price rate which made it reasonable value. My husband was taken ill so we had to stay an extra night for which they charged us full price - extortionate for what it was. The room was large and well equipped but the noise levels ridiculous. The people in the room next door seemed to run water every hour during the night and it was as if they were in the room with us. Also a great deal of noise from people arriving in the middle of the night and going out early in the mornings. We did not have one night of unbroken sleep. Prices in the restaurant were high although we only had breakfast there a couple of times. After that we brought in our own food for breakfast and found the fridge very useful for this. We chose to stay in this hotel as it was near to where our family live but would probably go further away next time to find a better hotel. The staff were eventually helpful when my husband was taken ill but initially did not seem interested. I found it difficult to arrange for a doctor to come, send faxes to the insurance company and so on and we were unable to arrange a late checkout on the day we were leaving for a midnight flight from the airport. The most helpful staff were on the garage level where they were unfailingly polite and helpful, opening car doors, dealing with luggage, operating the lifts and calling taxis when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value only if you don't mind the location”
Reviews.Author: Tommyyam
Reviews.Content: We visit durning Chinese new year, so hotel is expensive in HK. This hotel offer better price but in a more remote location. Very busy , too many visitor but services are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: BjHaave
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days before Christmas 2011 with a friend. I found the hotel clean and comfortable but the staff was a bit "distanced" the first few days. I took an extra breakfast and minibar included and in the end that payed off. I had free snacks and coffee in the lobby bar from morning to 8PM and that was nice. The hotel is located a bit off the beaten track but taxies are easy to obtain and cheap. Just about 4 min walk is a place that is worth visiting for those people that dare try a different dinner experience. Its called "Cooked Food Marked" and I found it interesting and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere ....”
Reviews.Author: ShahrilHarman
Reviews.Content: First of all, the subject is by no means negative. Seems like a very boutique hotel with many floors and right smack in the middle of an industrial area. Easy to find by cabbies from Wan Chai or Causeway Bay as it tends to be the only hotel in the Aberdeen area. New hotel that is nearby to some places of interest like The Peak, Ocean Park (within walking distance) and Stanley Market. Pros ; Rooms are clean and very up-to-date. Internet speed is good and area tends to quiet down by evening. You can have a full day at Ocean Park and just walk back. Shuttle buses to Hong Kong station or Causeway is great. I didnt have problems with cabs but I would imagine that may soon be a problem to get at the hotel if you miss the shuttle. Light behind the mirror and a magnifying mirror (for the ladies) is a nice touch. Check-in was quick and fast without hassle. I think because the hotel is new, it does not seem busy yet. We did have a bad experience as the bus leaves once its full. Did not expect to get to the waiting bay 10 minutes earlier and was told that the bus to Hong Kong station (going back to airport) has already left. The bus was a 16 seater minibus only. Ended up taking a cab to the airport. Cons ; Food eating places are hard to find from here. Conveniences are at a minimum like 7-11 as it is an out-of-the-way kind of area. The blinds that cover the bathroom is controlled from the room side. I find that baffling, and I dont understand the reason for it. A hotel I stayed at in Macau has the blinds controlled by the bathing person in the shower, not leave the showering man at the mercy of the blind being pulled or open from the room side, albeit by accident. If you take a cab, you have to bear with the Aberdeen tunnel traffic and have to pay the toll charges that comes with it when you go to and from Causeway Bay. Forget about MTRs, none nearby but I think they are building one in front of the hotel. But overall I like this hotel with things like security access and docking stations (iphones of course). I might consider staying here again on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: intlwanderlust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is recommended for those traveling with children. It is right by Ocean Park - 15 min walk (although the hotel offers a shuttle bus), it has a restaurant well equipped for kids and a kids menu. The breakfast buffet is good and has a nice mix of western and eastern foods. For a couple looking to go out at night and explore a bit, it's ok. The room is absolutely fine. Nice bed, quiet room and a nice bathroom with little toiletries. Aside from the day we went to Ocean Park, we took the shuttle bus into the city every day. The shuttle bus would be the biggest downer to the hotel. It's first come first served and many times the shuttle was packed to the gills. On the way back, from Central Station, we were 15 minutes early for our shuttle bus. We waited and when it arrived, I realized there was a group of 10+ people who were also waiting for this bus. Luckily we were the first on, but once they had all boarded, only one seat was left. We ended up waiting 10 min for a couple to show up, only to hear that only one of them could go. The same happened on the way into the city. We queued up for the 10am bus. When it arrived, there were over 10 of us waiting. The last two had to be turned away. The next bus was at 11:30. That's a long wait. I do think they need to do a booking system or rethink the shuttle a bit. Otherwise, it's a great hotel and excellent value for money. I'd definitely go back with kids.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected”
Reviews.Author: onelightyear
Reviews.Content: The surroundings are not as pleasant as I expected but at the same time it is much more convenient than I expected!! There are many buses and / or mini buses right outside the hotel lower floor entrance going as further out as the New Territories. Taxis are fast and cheap (about HK$60 to Central and takes 15 mins). The size of room is ok but the cleaning of the furniture (room cleaning is ok) needs to be improve especially when the chair is in bright orange!! It looks scarily dirty. The restaurant is cheap and the quality is adequate. I was surprised that it was somewhat quite. With the price we paid it was quite a good choice

Reviews.Title: “great free shuttle bus service”
Reviews.Author: geoff31_12
Reviews.Content: recently had two night stay which I enjoyed.The hotel is only two years old and is still in pristine condition.The room was very comfortable and furnished beautifully.Excellant bathroom with great power shower.Small gym with nice out door pool although closed in winter.Get the shuttle bus timetable from concierge and you will save a lot of money.Th hotel is located five minutes from ocean park and is about one mile walk to centre of Aberdeen.It takes between ten to twenty mins to get into central hong kong.Very well run hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in Xmas!”
Reviews.Author: manxxoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a package including 2 days pass of ocean park and a night's accommodation - we missed the shuttle but it was an easy 15 mins to ocean park. It's near to Aberdeen where u can experience sth different from the high rise in cbd- walking along the promenade at Aberdeen at night was wonderful with Xmas lights hanging on the trees. Just 20 mins away from causeway bay by bus !

Reviews.Title: “If not for the location in Aberdeen”
Reviews.Author: DNAseI
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very good. However, F&B in this location leaves much to be desired. The breakfast is expensive. Shuttle bus to Hong Kong MTR station can get full very fast if you are not down there early. This includes the shuttle to Ocean Park. For going downtown, take the lift down to the street level (not hotel lobby) and take KMB 75 to Pedder St stop. A Central MTR entrance is located there. Missed the shuttle back and we attempted to take a KMB night express bus back. With the tired children we gave in to taking a taxi. Costs us HKD80 from Hong Kong MTR Station. Doesn't matter if you go by Pok Fu Lam or the Aberdeen Tunnel. Until the new Wong Chuk Hang MTR Station is completed, guest better concede to taking KMB 75 to Central or taxis. A choice hotel if Ocean Park is your main objective with kids. The shuttle bus service brings you there for the opening of the park at 0930 and the shuttle bus also brings you back when the park closes at 2100.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeaW01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on 7 January and found the room to be very modern, clean and a good size. Yes, it is isolated and there is not much to see in the local vicinity apart from the MTR works but the shuttle bus runs every half hour and gets to Central in about 25mins via Ocean Park. I mainly booked it for it's proximity to Repulse Bay which is only about 10mins by taxi which was easy to hail and cheap. We took a 15mins walk to the harbour and accidentally came across the Jumbo Floating restaurant and Sampan rides (make sure you bargain for the latter and don't take the first price they offer!). Buffet breakfast was $120HK and had a range of western (cereals, eggs, baked beans, toast) and eastern (rice, dumplings, congee, noodles) choices. Overall we had a very nice experience here and I'd recommend to others looking for accommodation on Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Kamesan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, very clean and staffs are very friendly. The room we stayed was a city view on the 9th floor directly above the highway but perhaps because of thick window glass the street noise was not big enough to be annoying. The room was spacious for a Hongkong hotel and the bed was king-sized, not queen, and very comfortable. Free wi-fi was also good. A hotel of same standard in Central or Kowloon would cost nearly double, so it is worth staying here even you pay for taxis everyday. (Of course there are free shuttle services if you’re not in a hurry) Taxi fare to Central area, about HKD60 –80, to the airport HKD350 including surcharge. Contrary to other reviews, we found that there are some restaurants and a seven eleven in the vicinity. The hotel is built on a slope, so the main entrance is on the 4th floor (facing Tong Bin Lane to the north), reception desk on the 5th, and the back entrance is on the 1st floor facing Wong Chuk Hang Road to the South. If you go out from the back entrance on the 1st floor, there is a decent Chinese restaurant just next door on your left, open for breakfast and lunch only. If you cross the street from here there is an eatery directly opposite, also open for breakfast and lunch only. If you walk eastward a little toward Ocean Park from here and turn right at the ESSO gas station into a small pedestrian alley, you will find a Seven Eleven on the ground floor of One Island South bldg (3-min-walk). There is also a Starbuck café in the same bldg. The hotel is quite convenient if you visit Ocean Park. (You can buy entrance tickets at 10% off at hotel reception. Also, the ticket was for two-day entry at the price of one day ticket) The hotel provides shuttle services, but the last one from the park leaves before 8pm, before the sound and light show at 8pm. (which is quite spectacular!!) A large number of people go out from the park at once after viewing this show at about 8:20pm, so it is difficult to catch taxis or buses. But rather than queuing long time for a taxi, you can just walk about 15-20 minutes straight back to the hotel. The only drawback I noticed was that when I bought Ocean Park tickets at the hotel reception and paid by Master Card issued in Japan, they charged in JPY, not HKD, and the conversion rate was very bad. I don’t know if the hotel uses the same bad rate for foreign issued credit cards all the time, but beware when you pay a large bill by a foreign credit card. (We prepaid the room charge on Expedia)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and nice service!”
Reviews.Author: ishralene09
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I choose this hotel for our trip. I booked this hotel through AsiaWebDirect and got a good deal even though it's the Holiday season. We were given a City Room on the 22nd floor. The room was big, and still looks fresh. The TV channels were a little short, but no complaints since we are outside most of the time. The concierge were nice and easy to talk with. We tried eating breakfast one time, and it was good. The buffet food served was nothing palette-blowing but it was cheap at HKD100+ per person. and there are many choices, even cereals. The housekeeping is nice, they leave things as it is and just neat up the ones that are messy, which is good for me. The location is kind of far, but seeing as there's an MTR work on the way, as soon as the station near there is done I think people will frequent this hotel more. But no worries, as their free shuttle bus are always on time, on the dot if you asked me. If it leaves at 7, it really leaves at exactly 7. And the frequency of the trips is good. With all that I can say that the reservation was worth it. One more thing that made me really fond of this hotel is that whenever I send them mail regarding my reservation, their response is prompt and clear. I highly recommend this hotel, specially to those who wants to visit Ocean Park, as they also offer tickets to the park, we got our 2-day pass at HKD250 something, maybe 258, cheaper than the one-day pass you can get from the park itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cozy rooms, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: amitsriv
Reviews.Content: We visited Hong Kong during the first week of December. I was a little hesitant in booking this hotel for its off-beat location. However, I must say that the location is more than compensated with the great shuttle service. We used the shuttle service extensively and never had any issues . Moreover, OcenPark is just across and the Peak is also nearby. The Abradeen fishing village is also close. The rooms were of a decent size (I was warned that hotel rooms in HK are really small), in a city where space is at premium. The service was pretty good. We didn't try the restaurant primarily due to lack of vegetarian options. Please do remember to buy the Ocean Park tickets from the hotel. They are not only cheap but are valid for two days of consecutive entry into the Park. We also enjoyed late night shopping and could comfortably get back in time using the shuttle from Central.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, super comfortable accommodations, nice service”
Reviews.Author: ChaimL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during our first ever visit to Hong Kong. The room was very comfortable and was a nice size. The hotel is far away from all the action but it is easy to get to an from by the shuttle bus, local buses or taxi. The price is excellent, well below any hotel in central Hong Kong. It is great value for the money paid and I would definitely recommend it to others. There is a well equipped fitness center, a pool, and other amenities and you pay very low prices for luxury accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: lenny37
Reviews.Content: For the 1st time traveller, this hotel will seem out of the way for you. Look no further. I've done extensive searches on many hotel booking websites. The hotels located in the touristy areas are small and expensive. Its a trade off if you wish to pay for convenience. So what if the mtr is a "one min walk" away from the hotel? But the rooms are like shoe boxes? L hotel island south is located enroute aberdeen. Technically, the hotel is a 10mins shuttle bus ride away from wanchai which is pretty reasonable. Its near the ocean park. While there are no shops or restaurants within the vicinity, its merely a short bus ride to aberdeen for some neighbourhood shopping or food. The rooms are big by hk standards, well designed and modern. Theres a free shuttle to central. Ocean park is a short walk or shuttle bus ride away. Rooms come with either montain or city view. Wifi is free. Some other hotels charge like $40hk per hour? Go do your homework. Look at the reviews of hotels in town and see if the extra you pay for being near the mtr is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our stop over from London to Kong Kong after 6 weeks in Europe. We were extremely tired when we arrived at HK airport and there were issues with customs so it took an age to get through. Thankfully when we arrived at Hotel L' South the staff met us at the taxi and promptly took all of our luggage to the room, we were also directed to reception, where I was greatly impressed by the customer service and their english. The room was immaculate and the view really nice. It was just thing we needed as weary travellers. Surprisingly it was also the cheapest and best place we stayed all trip costing around $100AUD. The breakfast was nice, maybe a little different. Spring rolls with a boiled egg - but tasty all the same. Really happy with this place - would definitely stay again.The location is the only issue - with taxi being the main form of transport to the main island, but with fares of between $60-$100HK it is barely an issue.

Reviews.Title: “i like it here!”
Reviews.Author: hweech
Reviews.Content: for a HK hotel, the room is spacious. even comes with a sitting corner by the window to either put your things or sit there and idle. wifi is fast, ample breakfast variety and good service. the only bad thing about this hotel is its location. there seems to be nothing around it, but if you cross the road underneath the highway, you will find a rather big eatery/canteen which serves pretty ok food at cheap prices but tucked away inconspicuously from the hotel cos it's blocked by the highway. most taxi drivers know the way to the hotel so it's not hard to find. hotel also provides shuttle bus service to nearest mtr station.

Reviews.Title: “Best price / value in HK”
Reviews.Author: omundi
Reviews.Content: Incredible what you get for your money at this hotel. Modern, good-sized rooms, regular, free shuttle services to several locations in HK and a nice pool for a rate of USD 100 per night! Really loved this hotel. Only thing to improve is the breakfast buffet. It is diverse but it was not that delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: The_Great_Stuartio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hotel recently on a trip back to Hong Kong to visit friends. The hotel is clean and modern and the rooms are nice and spacious, especially for Hong Kong where hotel rooms in this price bracket are often miniscule. The hotel is based in Aberdeen on the southern side of Hong Kong island. There are frequent shuttle buses from the city centre and there are also numerous public buses which stop nearby which will take you most places of interest. I would say, however, if you are a first time visitor or not familiar with Hong Kong you may find this hotel too remote. This is especially true if you are a tourist because you might struggle to get to the places you want to see. Having said that the staff are very helpful and friendly. They will help you find what you need and tell you how to get around. Overall I would recommend this hotel as it is very comfortable and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but let down in a few areas”
Reviews.Author: Samin88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 2011 for 7 nights. It was our first trip to Hong Kong. I will start with the cons: (a) I do not recommend this for first timers or families with young kids - the location is too remote (unless you are going there SOLELY for Ocean Park). I read this in some of the other reviews but did not take heed and in hindsight would have picked a more central hotel (even for the higher price). However the hotel does provide a good bus service (refer pros). (b) The closest shopping center/shops area is in Aberdeen which is a 30HKD taxi ride away. Not expensive but as a family with small kids, the lack of immediate access (even to a 7-eleven) was highly inconvenient. The hotel menu items were ridiculously expensive. (c) Room service/cleaning was a disappointment. It was obvious that the cleaners barely spend anytime there - the sheets were never changed and on some of the days, the floor was barely swept! The pros are: (a) Good sized rooms (was expecting to be claustrophobic given all the reviews of other hotels) (b) Brand new hotel - so everything is new . (c) Super-convenient bus schedule to HK Central station (from there you can walk to the Macau ferry terminal, Peak Tram, catch the trams, trains to Kowloon etc) Note: There is a local cooked food market about a 15 min walk away. I would not recommend it for non-Asians as food hygiene did not seem to be of the highest standard across the different stalls I saw. Having said that there is a Thai food shop on the bottom floor corner which served excellent dishes (note: I have a cast iron stomach!).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, poor location for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: LSmithTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in November. The rooms themselves were very modern and nice looking with good amenities. We had two rooms for a family of four that were identical. They were side by side but not connecting. Our view was of a very ugly old building. The location of the hotel is poor unless you are going to Ocean Park. Also, there was a very strong smell of smoke in the hallways and the rooms. One of our rooms smelled of mold and when we called to complain, someone was sent to spray air freshener in our room to mask the smell for an hour. We were never offered another room and since it would have been inconvenient to change, we never asked. The hotel breakfast buffet fell flat. The scrambled eggs were seriously undercooked and looked like soup. The rest of the food offered was not of good quality or quantity. There is nothing within walking distance to do, see or buy. The hotel offers an airport shuttle, which we found very prompt. You can take this shuttle to Central Station and from there transfer to the subway. Kowloon is quite far. The subway is very clean and signs are also in English. We took a taxi from the hotel to Hong Kong Disneyland and it was about $300 HK or $40 American. We could have taken the hotel shuttle to Central Station and then caught the subway but opted for the easiest, quickest way. We called Pizza Hut for a room delivery once and it was very good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Standard room but with excellent concierge service”
Reviews.Author: YHTEO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for two nights in Oct 2011. Overall, the location is not fantastic but the hotel mitigated this with airport pickup and also shuttle services to selected places at different times of the day. There's a schedule list which is available to guests. During our stay, we traveled via taxis to and fro the hotel mainly. It's rather convenient, albeit can be a tad pricey especially during peak hours when one is caught in a traffic jam. We've had a room on the first floor of the hotel that comes with a balcony. It's a nice touch as we were able to sit outside to enjoy a drink though not much view to speak about as it faces a hill side. One thing we thought is highly commendable though is their excellent concierge service staff. They've helped us with restaurant bookings, sourcing of taxis etc.

Reviews.Title: “A very good price”
Reviews.Author: karos1
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, however it is quite a distance from the central areas. They do provide a courtesy bus but we used taxis to get around. It was $20hKD to Aberdeen, $75hkd to central and $120hkd to Kowloon. We stayed in a club room which was perfect, free Internet access, free lounge access with snacks and free minibar. They are currently building an MTR across from the hotel which will make it a more popular choice. Concierge is non existent but ask for Cherry, she was wonderful and looked after us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: frozencalbear
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is new and stylish but not very convenient to shops and restaurants. Room rates are very competitive. The room is a decent size, for HKG, and well appointed with flat screen tv's and updated surface finishes. Very comfortable bed with comforter. You will have to take a taxi or hotel shuttle to Central which can be inconvenient and expensive. The gym is small but has quality equipment. There is a small pool which can get crowded very quickly on a hot day. The breakfast buffet at HK$100 is a bit expensive for what you get. The options are definately skewed to Asian tastes. I had a comfortable stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PalashBagchi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reasonable, although priced on the higher side when compared to its offerings. Location is slightly off the main business districts but near to Ocean Park and Aberdeen fishing village. The hotel shuttle bus is very convenient and frequents between hotel and central station every hour. This is a fair savings in your local travel expenses. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are basic, some with a good mountain view, while others with a city view.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne E
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet and the reviews were really great and the price was affordable so I booked it. My expectations were high as the reviews were really glowing. And you know what? I was not disappointed. I printed out a schedule beforehand so on the day we arrived, we waited for the shuttle in front of the Airport Express Station. Good thing I took note of the number of the hotel so while waiting, I called to confirm if the shuttle was indeed coming and good thing I did because the shuttle was downstairs in Level 2, along with the other hotel shuttles so for those who are going to ride the shuttle, wait at LEVEL 2 of the Airport Express Station. There's a place for shuttles there. Anyway, the shuttle was on time and having it helped a lot as the hotel was far from any bus or mtr station. I wouldn't complain about the location of the hotel though because the shuttle made up for it. It was very efficient and on time. You could easily reach Central or Ocean Park through their shuttle service. The hotel itself didn't look like much from the outside but it was beautiful inside. The lobby was bright and elegant. The attendants were polite and we had no trouble checking in. Also, their service call center was really helpful. The rooms were great! What you see in the pictures is what you get. They had complimentary water, coffee, tea and fruits also. They have hairdryers and a gadget where you can connect your ipod to and play music and charge it at the same time. They also had adaptors which were great because the electric sockets were different from the ones at home. The bathroom had a see through "wall" but it had blinds so there was no problem. They have bath tubs too! It was great to come home to the hotel after a tiring day and take a long warm bath. We had the hillside view and it was indeed relaxing. We went around the hotel and we saw the pool. It was inviting and there wasn't anyone swimming then but we were too tired so werent able to try it. But it was cool because from the gym you have to take a cute little elevator to get to pool. It was only like a half level down though... haha... Also, the hotel had free wifi which was a great bonus! The only downside was that on our second day, the shuttle to Central had already left so we decided to take the chuttle to Causeway Bay instead. We thought they would drop us off at the Causeway Bay MTR station but the driver stopped at this obscure street instead! Being first time tourists, we wanted some direction so we asked the driver about the way to the MTR station and he SHOOED us away! He refused to answer our questions and so we were forced to alight and he left us there! We could've gotten lost! Good thing we asked around and some friendly people pointed us in the right direction. I can't believe the driver was so unhelpful and rude! That was the only bad thing, though.The other drivers were friendly and helpful. Another plus was that we got our Ocean Park tickets for 10% less at the hotel! And it was for two days! We didnt get to use it the next day though because we went home but still, we were thankful. Also, another great thing was that after we checked out, they still allowed us to leave our baggage with the concierge and we just came back for it when we were ready to go to the airport. All in all, we had a great stay at this hotel and I would definitely recommend it to my friends. I would also be coming back. (^______^)

Reviews.Title: “I've been to Hong Kong many times but this hotel is the most luxorious and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: EvilDaifu
Reviews.Content: Okay, it depends on what you want. Do you want the world famous hustle and bustle of the former British colony or been there done that and now want to see a different side of Hong Kong? Well, you can't go too wrong with Aberdeen which is walking distance from L'Hotel. The Junks have all left now - but you can still guess how it might have looked in the past. And the shopping in Aberdeen is just a little cheaper than the famous Ladies Streets on Kowloon side. So I chose this hotel because of it's rating in TripAdvisor - and you won't be disappointed. Staff very friendly (no snares and no jibes at my broken Cantonese). And the free shuttle bus is amazingly on time true to the timetable (roughly every hour between 7am and mid-night) that will get you to Ocean Park (for the kids) or to Hong Kong station so it's easy to get into the hustle bustle again when you suffer withdrawal LOL. I had the mountain view and I guess it was pieceful but am advised by others on TripAdvisor that the city view is more dreamy. I didn't eat in - preferring the local cuisine in Aberdeen. A few old temples in Aberdeen and Ap Lei Chau Island (Iand the HKD $1.80 harbour short boat ride from Aberdeen to Ap Lei Chau is worth it for a closer look at the bay and its inhabitants). There is a little secret walk hidden up to a valley cut by a river just to the left of Aberdeen Technical School - it's not documented anywhere but a reminder of maybe what Aberdeen was like before people started populating the lower reaches near the bay. It has complimentary WiFi which worked fine for me and allowed me to catch up on some work. The bay windows in my hotel room were very panoramic and everything was so clean and spotless. And I could spread our my arms and there was no fear of touching opposing sides of the room walls as can sometimes be the norm if you are staying down in TsimShaTsui area LOL (been there done that!), What's more my luggage got delayed through a tight connecting flight (I got on but my luggage didn't LOL) - so I was really appreciative of all the bathroom amenities like toothbrush, shaver, etc. on hand. I chose this hotel for a different experience of Hong Kong and like me, hopefully you won't be disappointed! Well worth the stay and was the cheapest hotel I could also find at this time of year Oct in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel for all”
Reviews.Author: review2010_10
Reviews.Content: We searched and booked this hotel online. It cost about HK$400 to get there from the airport if your flight arrived in the midnight. Free shuttle throughtout the day providing super conveninece from the hotel to the Central AirportLine station (IFC). Spacious room. Everything is clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Very good price. What could you ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend for Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: little_peg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in early September. It was not easy to get there as it was not nearby any public transport station. Forunately, the hotel had free shuttle travelled from MTR Hong Kong Station to the hotel. It is better for traveller to search the schedule of the shuttle in the hotel website in advance. The staff there were friendly and efficient. The room was cozy. However, the quality of the resturant was poor. I tried the dessert during tea time and the dinner buffet. The food was unpalatable. It is better for traveller to go to Ap Lai Chau for local food which is cheaper and more delicious. Overall, I would recommend traveller to have short stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My return trip to L'Hotel Island South Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: yopaullie
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at L'Hotel Island South in Hong Kong. As always the service is excellent. The L'Hotel is located walking distance from Ocean Park, if you like to walk. Most everyone uses the shuttle provided by the hotel. The shuttle service is very outstanding. I use the shuttle to travel to Central station. In 2015 there will be a MTR station that will open very close to Ocean Park and the L'Hotel. My room is clean, the bed is comfortable and the most of all the bathroom clean. Fresh towels and linens can be requested daily but you are also able to opt for every other day in an effort to be part of the green solution. I like that about hotels that are looking to better the environment. The pool and gymnasium are very nice and very clean. The pool is located on one of the upper decks and perfect for sitting out side and enjoying a cup of coffee. The gym is located directly next to the pool. Perfect for a quick workout. I hope to stay in one of the suites as I have not stayed in one of the suites yet. Service - the staff is wonderful. From the minute you arrive in the carport you are greeting by friendly smiles and helpful L'Hotel staff members. The gentlemen in the car port are attentive, opening doors, getting the elevators and most of all getting you from taxi or shuttle to your location. Thank you car port gentlemen, job well done. The front desk staff is courteous and efficient. Assisting you with all requests and making sure you stay is enjoyable. The lobby lounge on P5 is very nice. Coffee or a quick snack are to available for guests. A very attentive staff insures that you have all you need and service is provided with a smile. There is one gentlemen I would like to give kudos to. His name is Alex Chow, he is one of the management staff and he always remembers my name, greets me with a smile and handshake. Mr. Chow is a fine representative of the L'Hotel staff. Please be sure to introduce yourself to Mr. Alex Chow and tell him Paul Ortiz from Las Vegas sends his regards. Thank you L'Hotel staff for a great traveling experience. Mr. Alex, Chow, Mr. Nelson Poon and the entire staff at L'Hotel. I am enjoying my stay in Hong Kong and at the end of my long work days here in Hong Kong it is s pleasure to come back to the hotel and relax. Many many thanks Paul Ortiz Las Vegas, NV USA

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Marisol C
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about L'hotel Island South... -Upon arrival someone always walked up to the taxi to open the door -Reception staff had no problem with printing out directions to a Dim Sum restaurant we wanted to go to -Staff assisted in hailing a taxi -Electricity converter provided in room (next to coffee pot) -FREE high speed WI-FI -Personalized welcome message on TV upon room entry -VERY clean room and bathroom had a phone in it -In room safe, IPOD docking station and mini fridge available for use (items in mini fridge NOT complimentary, but that was a-ok with me) -ALL YOU CAN DRINK from 1900-2100 for $98 HKD -A filipino lounge singer that played songs that I liked -The buffet was pretty impressive (though I didn't partake) For the price, it's definitely a steal- I'll be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, Close to Ocean Park but Expensive food”
Reviews.Author: RitayanRoy
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to stay in Hong Kong. This is not really inside the center of the city and no food shop nearby, but the accommodation is reasonably cheap in terms of quality. We used cab most of the times to go to city as the hotel bus service is on time and we were not interested to wait. The taxi is not very cheap, so, you may consider to pay a bit more to stay in a hotel inside city. If you want to spend more time in Ocean park, then this hotel is perfect. The hotel is very clean, with swimming pool and gym. The furniture, TV, Bed, decoration etc. is very new and modern. As for me Hong Kong is not really a nice place to visit, but if you wish to visit Hong Kong, you can definitely stay in this hotel. The hotel is perfect for family and couple, but may not be for people who loves to drink, night clubbing, or little more fun stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel -- will be even better when Hong Kong subway extension gets built.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel61
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel that aims for a stylishness and sophistication that it does not yet attain. The chill design works quite well in the lobby, but the rooms and dining area are a bit bland. The main beef with this hotel though is that it is in the middle of nowhere. Walk out, and you are on a nob-descript industrial-looking road without a café or restaurant in sight. Late-night arrivals are told by staff that the only food option around is a bag of chips at the nearby gas station. The only attraction in the area is Ocean Park, and that leads to the second beef with the hotel: it is full of families with kids, and so can get a bit noisy. The situation might improve when the Hong Kong subway extension opens in a year or two. But right now you can do a lot better on Hong Kong Island or Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: morenabeachbumm
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to HongKong for our annual summer vacation and I enjoyed my stay here very much! The hotel isn't located on Nathan Road or anywhere near the shopping district but they do have great shuttle service which took you to the central terminal (15 minutes away) which was very convenient. From the central terminal, you could go anywhere basically, so I don't see why some reviewers complained about the location. Oh, and if you're traveling with kids, it's great because it's so near Ocean Park. Aside from that, they have great service and the rooms were always sparkling clean. Room service came everyday and even folded clothes lying around (they didnt just hang it on the back of the chair or something) and they always refilled the "goodie bag" filled with toothbrush, shower gel, shower cap, comb, etc even though they didn't really need to. All the amenities you needed were there, adapter suited for HK outlets, hair dryer, tea pot, coffee, tea, etc. All in all, we had a great time and our stay was made comfortable by having a comfy, great hotel to come "home" to every night. :)

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, we will stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Spyhotelier
Reviews.Content: Very good services from the front desk and the restaurant. Although the location is not as good as some others hotels in Hong Kong, we still would like to stay there again because of their services. (not only the front office staff was helpful but also the restaurant staff was friendly.)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and value for money”
Reviews.Author: khawhj
Reviews.Content: We stayed there mainly because it was near to Ocean Park. The hotel is clean and modern. We took the hotel shutter bus to Ocean Park. The journey took just ten minutes! The best part was we enjoyed a 10% discount plus free next day entry to the park when we purchased the tickets from the hotel reception! That was a pleasant surprise and the kids enjoyed another day there. There was no shops around the hotel. Breakfast was a problem. There was a restaurant in the hotel that served breakfast but not many patronised it. Would suggest you bring your own breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I'll surely come back”
Reviews.Author: Tasha1302
Reviews.Content: The hotel is worth the money spent there. It is really new and very comfortable. I loved the room and especially bathroom. The servise was also good. Food and drinks in the bar are expensive, but you can always walk just a 15 minutes to Aberdeen or take a bus there, and you'll find several restaurants with really competitive pricing and good quality of food. Shuttle bus is frequent and convenient, Ocean Park and Jumbo are near by. If you are in HK for rest and siteseing that's the best choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids, big rooms in HK. Definately stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: CaptnToby
Reviews.Content: Thank you reviewers ... I choose this hotel thanks to you. and we love it!! I've stayed in many Hotels in HK with & without kids. BUT L'Hotel island south is the most value for $$ in HK wrt to Cleanliness / new / services. Wow the $$$ you save on accommodation, you can catch as many Taxi as you like. You are still ahead. Also with kids, MTR is not a great option, as it takes about 5-10min walking before you get to the actual MTR and too hectic. We when to HK with 3.5 & 7.5 yr. L'hotel is in a semi industrial area, but you can hope in a TAXI for 30HKD in 5 min you are in Aberdeen Center where you find food and local shopping center. We feed the whole family + taxi fare for less then $25AUD. As we have young kids, we came back to hotel every afternoon for a rest and out again for dinner. The room is big, we had a double double-bed hill facing high floors (yes choose Hill facing, as city is not great if you are on lower floor). The room is big - Australia standard, and there is a enclose window section where my kids played behind the DARK curtain while we slept in. It was great. Will definitely stay here again with or without kids. The Hotel is not in the mist of shopping center, but there's a bus stop right under the hotel. Stuff was great - speaks English and very helpful. To MongKok (ladies market): Thanks to the hotel staff, we were recommended to catch a bus no. 171 (right outside the hotel) with kids to get to MongKok, instead of Taxi. As Taxi takes longer in peak hours. So we caught the bus and surprisingly it only took 30min and 3 stops later. I can't believe how the inconvenient hotels became the convenient hotel!! To Causeway : Taxi only cost $50 to 60 HKD = 8 AUD wow To Aberdeen: Taxi = 30HKD = 4 AUD wow To Stanley Market: Taxi = 70 HKD = 10 AUD To Victoria Park = 100 HKD = 12 AUD Lastly, we have stayed in hotels that is right next to MTR, but by the time we walk through the tunnels we could have caught a taxi for a little more. We will stay there again even without kids. We love it, especially the size of the bedroom. Hope you find this useful. p.s. Free fast speed WiFi

Reviews.Title: “100euros well-spent”
Reviews.Author: Kushnarova
Reviews.Content: space-futuristic style of lobby. very good room, looks u are first to live in. poor breakfast... few stuff to eat... and everything looks plastic))) the personal quick and professional. free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: HongKongAnonymous
Reviews.Content: I have never encountered less accommodating staff and management. The staff was unable to ever get the wireless working in one room and made it very clear they could care less. The bell man remembered my colleague giving him his bag but would not let him have it for an entire day because he had misplaced the claim tag. In spite of reservations being made and a credit card on file, members of our party were made to sit in the lobby for over an hour when they came back from being away from hotel for one night because the hotel demanded the card be physically present before letting them back into the rooms. Then the staff got angry because they were waiting in lobby and taking up too many seats. Another colleague's phone was off the hook and the staff promised to physically deliver an urgent phone message but never did. The lobby has overwhelming bad air freshener being pumped in as well. DO not go here if you value customer service. It was a professional embarrassment to book colleagues at L'Hotel, Island South.

Reviews.Title: “I would definetly come back to this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Sonamkiet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a "must" to stay. Pricing was reasonable, room was spacious/clean wth modern tech-free wifi/flat screen tv, bed was very comfy n view of mountain (we stayed on the 18th flr) . Hotel provides transport to nearest MTR but seat easily fill up so the next alternatives will be to take a cab and it's less than 15 mins to reach Admiralty MTR so no worries abt late night, board the last train and take a cab back to hotel very convenient. The bathroom is definetly a wow...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel inside - within walking distance of Ocean park”
Reviews.Author: Markfennelly
Reviews.Content: Booked here to visit Ocean park as we had ben staying in oterh parts of Hong Kong and were travelling around. Hotel nice inside - very stylish but a bit bland - a case of of style over practicality with piped music playing everywhere and a complicated lift system. in a downtown part of Hong Kong called Abderdeen which is a bit quiet with not much to do apart from visit Ocean Park theme park which is a great day out and get hte bus back into Hong Kong or Stanly which is a quaint place up the road. Charged a 10% service charge each night which we hadnt paid in any other hotels - not sure what this was for - hopefully it want as a tip to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and Practical”
Reviews.Author: Malc63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights because it was on the south side of the island. There aren't too many hotels here. L'Hotel (the "L" Hotel, to the taxi drivers!) seems to be very new. It oozes chic, but i am not quite sure what it is pretending to be. It is relatively plush, spotlessly clean, and reasonably priced. There is nothing to complain about, but again, not a lot to write home about either. It is simply a hotel. Its problem has to be its location. It is really handy for Ocean Park, but nothing else. That said, in Hong Kong you are only a bus ride or a taxi journey from anywhere you want to be. The staff were helpful, but I wish they (and I mean Hong Kong hotels in general) would get used to chip and pin credit cards. I had to go the local ATM to get cash because their system didn't like my card. I had that problem a few times during this trip. OK for purchases, but it didn't like pre-authorisation. A good hotel that would have no hesitation recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a good hotel but too many small things let it down”
Reviews.Author: Danionholiday
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel in Hong Kong when the rugby was on and we could find nowhere more central. The location is not great - Aberdeen seemed like quite a grotty part of town - but there are shuttle buses into town every few hours or taxi's are still pretty cheap to Central HK. You get a much bigger room here than in Central HK which is good. There were just too many little quirks which let this hotel down - no dressing gown in the room, although my colleagues said they had them but when I asked for one at reception they said they had run out, our mini bar was locked when we arrived and there was a massive wardrobe but without a single drawer to put things away in, WiFi in the room was very slow too. We went for the club lounge package but wouldn't recommend it, just a few soft drinks (and they ran out of water) and nacho chips which they lock up early and are constantly asking for your room number when you're in the lounge area. Breakfast was not great, although there was some fresh fruit which I enjoyed. The gym was nice though and the pool looked great (but didn't open till April). The staff were very polite too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: robby321
Reviews.Content: Traveled by myself in early March 2011, as my relatives in HK had no room for poor little me. Anyways, for the price of the rooms, you would be hard pressed to find a cleaner hotel, as spacious bed and bath rooms, convenient shuttle service to the main MTR subway stations, with a pretty decent gym as well. My reviews state that the location is not ideal, but for the prices they charge, no one should be complaining. A taxi ride to Admiralty Station took about 15 minutes for only about $60HK, but a taxi should only be used if the FREE shuttle service to and from the hotel cannot be utilized. The shuttle has a very routine schedule that stretches late into the night (I once used the last shuttle pickup, which was about 23.30). The bed was comfortable and soft, though I didn't really need 4 pillows. The bathroom was spotlessly clean everyday and the bathtub and shower each were perfect.
