Great TV channel selection as well on days where you want to lie in a little. Quick and efficient service at the front desk for checking in and out, as well as giving me instructions on bus routes that I needed. The bus stop right outside the hotel was also a HUGE plus. Now I have been to HK before so I was able to get around the city quite easily from L'Hotel. However, I DO agree with my fellow travelers that if you are new to the city and don't speak Cantonese, this hotel's location may be hinder your trip. However, it is right by Ocean Park, so....kinda evens out.

Reviews.Title: “Irritating Quirks”
Reviews.Author: jmhpaterson
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week here on business. Comfortable with friendly, helpful and efficient staff, but noisy and frenetic. Loud muzak in all areas at all times. Poor and intermittent internet access in rooms, at least those on 26th floor. No lounge area to speak of, unless you pay for separate package that allows you to use the lobby lounge. Breakfast buffet OK unless crowded and busy, when it becomes chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in far away location”
Reviews.Author: sanChd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nicely made. The rooms are quite spacious and elegantly built. But the location is quite far off especially if you are not a regular visitor to Hong Kong. Prefer this hotel only if you Hong Kong well.Not for first time travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money..”
Reviews.Author: Mrseano
Reviews.Content: Although a little bit out of town, we really enjoyed our stay at the L hotel.The room was spacious, with modern facilitie's .A bus stop is just outside the side entrance,and the transport system is brilliant in HK,so getting around is easy.The staff were great,the food there was a little pricey, but the buffet breakfast was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad location.”
Reviews.Author: jedimaster10248
Reviews.Content: The key reason we book this hotel was for free high speed internet and it was fast. Unlike all the other hotels in Hong Kong even the most expensive one this one give you free Internet other hotel want you to pay a lot of money for just haft and hour to access the Internet and your only allowed to access it on one computer. The only flaw this hotel has is the location and distance from the airport. If you want to explore Hong Kong you'll need to take a taxi. The distance from the airport is about 45 minutes by taxi. I recommend you take the train instead to get to the hotel it's cheaper, faster, and it also give you a free shuttle to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian0815
Reviews.Content: The L'hotel Island South is maybe a bit off the tourist tracks and may not have a lot of shops/retaurant/super markets in the direct surrounding but it is a very nice, new hotel that offers a lot of comfort for little money (compared to hk standards). Bus stops in front of the hotel bring you to the busy areas like causeway bay or central. The rush hour is however a problem that frequently jams the Aberteen tunnel. If you plan accordingly you can avoid long waiting time in the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service & Front Desk Staff Speak Limited English”
Reviews.Author: YT
Reviews.Content: The room is quite spacious by Hong Kong standard but sound proofing is not good, I could hear noises from corridors every night. The location is not really suitable for a first-timer to Hong Kong, hotel is surrounded by industrial buildings. Besides the bad location, our check-in was not a pleasant experience, front desk staff looked stressed and did not even bother to smile. Apparently the hotel was having full occupancy during our stay there and the hotel staff obviously was not coping well. I am fine with front desk staff's limited English but not cold and unfriendly responses. The free wi-fi is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: We found reception to be very cold, no smiles and mechanical. We were not happy with being given two singles beds. They offered to join them together and a lady came shortly to do this with a heap of new linen. She stripped the beds and for some reason couldn't make it up with the new linen, she made a call and remade the beds as they were to start with. What a waste of time for her and privacy for us. The hill view is simply that, it is of a hill, not a mountain and it is fairly close to the hotel so that is basically all you see, it's probably better than the cityview unless you are on a very high floor. The hotel is out of the way and unless you want to spend the day in Aberdeen or OceanPark there is not much point in staying there. The hotel is new and as such everything works well and it looks lovely. It is pleasant to stay there. The technology is up to date. Another thing that annoyed us was being greeted by a locked fridge so someone else had to come and unlock that for us. That's fine if hotels want to lock fridges but they should advise customers at the time of checking in

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant time”
Reviews.Author: ralpthgambihler1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the room was basic and reasonable price. I had my room cleaned everyday and quite neat. The staff was very courteous. I was very pleasant to stay there and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel in an ugly part of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: MarkGD
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very good value for money - it was much cheaper than those anywhere near the top of the island or the tip of Kowloon. It is quite new, thus everything works well, and it is modern and efficient in design. Amenities are good though service was at times a bit slow. Free WiFi also a big plus. The main downside is the location. You can get there easily from Central station by catching a 70 bus and it only costs about HKD5 (about A70c). Access is not a problem as there are major expressways all over the place. The downside is the local area which is very ugly and run down, with dirty streets and delapidated factories (some closed). Yet if you are using it for overnight stays, it is not a big deal. Further, there is virtually no shopping around and we ate in the city area. The hotel itself has a rather mediocre cafe. It is definitely worth staying at for business or similar, though hardly a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean rooms with very slow service.”
Reviews.Author: meowster81
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed for a couple nights seeing that it is a new hotel. The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable so we were able to sleep well. I guess it is a still a new hotel, the water that came out to draw a bath was initially BROWN. so I had to run it for at least 5minutes before it cleared up. My husband had to go online but the wireless was not working/connecting, so we requested for a cable to be sent up. Unfortunately it took a whole morning for them to bring that up. My husband was unable to send emails to work or clients that day due to their slow service. I ordered room service as well and the food was great. I would strongly recommend this to friends and family who are travelling for leisure but NOT RECOMMENDED for business travel due to their slow service.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel in a strange location”
Reviews.Author: hserus
Reviews.Content: Picked this because it was convenient for the Cyberport, where I had meetings. The hotel about four bus stops away from the floating restaurant / aberdeen harbor area, surrounded by derelict "factory buildings". The hotel itself is brand new, chic, and wouldnt look out of place in Central or Causeway Bay. Comfortable beds, large rooms by HK standards, rather than shoeboxes (at 700 hkd a night, go figure). Above average seafood in the restaurant. The only problem is location. You want to see the sights or eat out somewhere, you have to catch a bus right outside the hotel, or hail a cab, head out to causeway bay or north point. Or maybe to aberdeen for the floating tourist traps. Oh yes, and make sure you ask for a high floor - the traffic noise (trucks, mostly) from nearby was slightly audible even on the 9th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Weak service and bad location”
Reviews.Author: TrustedOpinion
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been open for a few months. The location in the Aberdeen section of HK is very inconvenient, not to mention desolate (there's nothing around). There are numerous significant service issues and inconsistencies which made our stay frustrating and the reception staff needs to be trained better to deal with the public - especially guests from outside China. Don't bother requesting the type of room you would like as you won't get it - Although the rooms are good and spacious for HK standards, it's not enough of a reason to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Price and new brand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bittencourt
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nigths at this Hotel. We (me, wife, son 7 yo and daugther 4yo) got a pleasant stay despite location. Clean rooms with brand new furniture, cozy environment. The breakfast is not good for those like options, there are few options to breakfast. The location is terrible but dont worry because just 10min you reach Causeway Bay or HK Central station by taxi with just (~ HKD 70), also there are free shutle bus from Hotel for these places but not too offen making you adjust your schedule better. It is very close to Ocean Park, but we got bad lucky during our visit to park because all the rides was cancelled that day making my kids upset/frustated just seeing around was boring for us. There are no option to dinner around hotel, just the restaurant at hotel. Few options in the menu but very nice atmosphere. Free internet available in the room at very good speed.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, not centrally in HK, but good choice at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: altkoenig1975
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay there. Good budget choice if you find downtown 4/5* hotels in HK to expensive. 4 nights at ~3500 HKD is ok. Free WLAN, nice pool, Free Hotel Shuttle to HK Central station several times per day, but taxi to HK central is not to expensive either (~100HKD). The area around the hotel is not very pleasant, but that does not really matter if you stay downtown HK most of the time. The design of the hotel is very modern, rooms are spacious and have all relevant amenities (good bed, flat screen TV, large window, good shower).

Reviews.Title: “"outstanding service, great hotel"”
Reviews.Author: jamesmhiel
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in this hotel for 11 days.Our room is spacious and the view is terrific.We had the cityview room 2810 and we were very satisfied.We have complimentary newspapers everyday.We found it amazing that the butterfly decorations in the hallways are made of recycled cd's.The menu's, shuttel bus schedules...etc ..are in the tv.The service is wonderful specially one of the general manager whom i forgot the name.Rooms are very clean too.We liked the way they did the bathroom.Even the cleaning ladies are very friendly, i remember me and my partner nicknamed one of them"smiley:)"obiously cause she always smiles.Although the location is a bit far from the city<about 20 mins> the hotel's shuttle busses are very convenient.I suggest they work on their communication skills cause the driver barely speak english.We would stay in this hotel again.And again... Attached are few pics from our stay....

Reviews.Title: “BRAND SPANKING NEW BUT POOR LOCATION .”
Reviews.Author: stevenng84
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 7 nights, only minutes from Ocean Park. I booked 2 weeks in advance with no cancellation allowed. Rates and packages varies everyday. Nearest shopping and restaurants is a 10 minutes taxi ride. Courtesy bus service not regular, waiting area is outdoor. Location is remote but public transport is excellent. Good for relaxation and not recommended for shoppers. Advance booking rates is sometime more expensive than daily rates. Spent lots of time travelling to and from places. Finally, its value for money. Overall stay is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel / Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: yopaullie
Reviews.Content: I am currently at L'tHotel Island South in Hong Kong - more specifically in Aberdeen. The property is brand new. It is immaculate. The service is five star. The hotel offers many services and the concierge service is outstanding. The hotel is located in an industrial part of Hong Kong. There is currently not MTR service to this part of Aberdeen although this is not shortage of taxi's, buses and the hotel provided an excellent shuttle service. The hotel shuttles are scheduled to run at regular intervals. Going to Central Airport Express, HK Station, Causeway Bay, Ocean Park, Aberdeen Center, Cyberport, Admiralty. You can easily get to many other locations once you reach the shuttle stop. The MTR is fantastic here in Hong Kong. I easily commuted around Hong Kong without any issues. Be sure to get and Octopus card. Getting back to L'Hotel The rooms are perfect. My room had two small beds with a firm mattress. Two small nightstands, large bay window, bathroom with bathtub shower. Small closet for hanging my clothes, small dresser and small mini fridge. Be sure to bring a power convertor if you need to plug in your computer or phone but if you forget not to worry L'Hotel will provide you with a convertor. The is TV in the room with international channels. Although I never turned on my TV. Air conditioning works great being that it is so humid this time of year.....it was a blessing. The restaurant down stairs serves a very nice breakfast about $13.00 US I did not have opportunity to eat dinner in the hotel. The hotel also has a very nice swimming pool, exercise room and meeting rooms. When you are here be sure to ask for Mr. Alex Chow - Guest Services Manager. He is a wealth of information and an outstanding host. I met Alex when I arrived and when ever I needed assistance Alex or his well informed staff at L'Hotel always has an answer. Directions to locations, places to shop or visit, shuttle times or alternate travel they always have a courteous smile a excellent answers. I am still at the hotel now and will be leaving for the mainland in a few days. On my return to Hong Kong I will be returning to L'Hotel for a second stay. I would strongly suggest L'Hotel to my fellow trip advisor readers, business colleagues and travel representatives. I noticed that the hotel was completing a photo shoot for what appeared to be an ad campaign. Hopefully they will provide more photos on their web page showcasing their outstanding property.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Strabo
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have mentioned, the location is not great if you are a first time tourist as it's located in a semi light industrial area with nothing interesting except Aberdeen (Jumbo floating restaurant) & Ocean Park nearby. But if you are prepared to use public buses or taxis, it really isn't an issue. The rooms were spacious by Hong Kong standards, free wifi & an iPod dock with radio. Do note that although their website says "double double" beds, the beds are actually super single size & not double bed size! We were a family of four so we got 2 connecting rooms. The connecting rooms do not have king/twin bed combos but twin beds only. In one of the rooms the twin beds can be pushed together, the other is separated by a bedside table. If you have kids do note that the connecting rooms are not the usual style where there is a connecting door(s) within the rooms. In fact, they are connected via a main door with a small "foyer" that leads to the 2 rooms, each with separate key card access. To get snacks & stuff, there is an ESSO gas station opposite the hotel. There is a tiny stall outside the hotel by the bus stop that sells sweets, drinks, etc. A local eatery is abt 30m away & another one opposite the hotel. But these appear to only cater to the weekday working crowd in the area & closed on weekends. The hotel has shuttles to & from Central, Ocean Park, Admiralty & Causeway Bay on a fixed schedule. Otherwise the public buses outside will pretty much take you anywhere. Easy to get a taxi fm outside the hotel too. We tried the seafood dinner buffet at LIS (restaurant). Please note you have to make advanced reservations or you may not get to dine as they are apparently fully booked every evening. We weren't aware of this but managed to persuade them to let us have a table. The spread is huge & quality good. The sashimi in particular was fantastically fresh with a very wide choice of raw fish. Service was attentive. Currently, hotel guests get 30% off. The swimming pool is of a decent size. Completely deserted on weekdays so had it all to ourselves which was nice. Would stay here again if the prices remain competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value, but pretty isolated”
Reviews.Author: cameron66
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel itself is new and up to 4 star standards. With the current soft opening special, it is great value. The staff was very friendly without exception. Breakfast was pretty sparse but cheap for Hong Kong at HK 108 + so can't really complain. The room had a huge and soft bed, wireless internet is free. Floors were hardwood, not carpet. The rooms are missing some of the bells and whistles you see in new hotels (no Ipod deck, speakers in bathroom, seperate shower stall etc) but as the hotel is not really positioned as a 5 star hotel that is normal. The front desk told me that most of their clients were either going to Ocean Park (very close) or tourist groups (with bus). The reason why I asked is that the hotel is literally in the middle of nowhere. You have a 20 minute walk to the nearest 7/11 and 25 minutes to a grocery store. If you have a car or are part of a tour group it doesn't really matter. Also, there is a bus stop about a 5 minute walk from the hotel that will take you pretty much anywhere and taxis are not too difficult to find. But make sure you know what you are getting yourself into. Very high value (at least now with the price so low) but far away from anything.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: DBTT
Reviews.Content: The only reason why I did not rate L Hotel Island South as excellent is because I know the price is going to change once the hotel gains its full potential. As a brand new hotel, the prices were only around 500HKD when I was traveling which is some 300-500 below market price and a veritable bargain. I stayed a total of 3 or 4 nights in a few separate occasions and I have been extremely pleased every time. The hotel itself is situated in Aberdeen which is a bit off if you visit Hong Kong as a tourist, but the hotel is right next to a bus stop, the taxis in HK are very cheap and the hotel offers free shuttle bus services to central. The restaurant was not yet operational when I traveled and as such we took a taxi to the heart of Aberdeen to have some nice local cuisine. The rooms are extremely comfortable. As a new hotel, there is nothing bad to say about the rooms and the cleanliness and the look of the hotel itself. 30sqm (ard 300sqft) is well enough for two people and somewhat luxurious in HK. I had both the hillview and the cityview rooms and both have fairly nice views, but nothing too spectacular. What I really appreciated at L Island South was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. If anyone at Island South is reading this review, I would like to express my gratitude for outstanding service that I got each and every time (even the time when I almost PK'd in the lobby and the clerk couldn't stop laughing) The luxurious service along with spacious and cozy rooms make Island South one of the best hotels I have stayed in HK even though the location is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable mid-range hotel with a high service standard”
Reviews.Author: sant0224
Reviews.Content: We stayed in L'Hotel Island South for five nights. We took advantage of the soft opening offer and paid under 50 pounds per night for a spacious room. Yes, the restaurant, the fitness room and the pool had yet to open, but it was a very comfortable stay nonetheless. The room was spacious, though we thought an extra chair could even be put near the window without making the room look cluttered. We were particularly impressed by the Revo Domino 2 Internet radio set! We loved to be able to tune into BBC Radio 4 and JazzFm! Everything else was just spotless - no complaint. The staff were keen to make sure our stay was hassle-free. They may not have those bright young things manning the reception or the coincerge, but they were all well-trained and put on a geuine smile to greet you. A great thumbs-up for their helpfulness. The location of the hotel may look a little off the beaten track for tourists who are interested in sight-seeing, but it is just a 15-minute ride by taxi to Wanchai or Central on a good day. The bus stop is just outside the hotel and you can get to anywhere on the island by bus. Overall, this was a very pleasant experience and we look forward to our next stay with them.
